com.cmput301f19t09.vibes.fragments.moodlistfragment

Class FollowedMoodListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • android.widget.ArrayAdapter<MoodEvent>
        • com.cmput301f19t09.vibes.fragments.moodlistfragment.MoodListAdapter
          • com.cmput301f19t09.vibes.fragments.moodlistfragment.FollowedMoodListAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.Filterable, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, android.widget.ThemedSpinnerAdapter

    public class FollowedMoodListAdapter
extends MoodListAdapter
    This subclass of MoodListAdapter is responsible for managing the dataset of MoodEvents containing the (single) most recent MoodEvent of each of the Users that the primary (signed in) User follows

    • Method Detail

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Add observers to all of mainUser's followed Users. This should be called when the parent Fragment resumes so that Observers can be re-added
        Overrides:
        resume in class MoodListAdapter

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Remove all observers on followed users. This should be called when the parent fragment pauses so that the instance is not being updated in the background
        Overrides:
        pause in class MoodListAdapter

      • refreshData

        public void refreshData()
        Go through all observed_users and add their most recent MoodEvent to the List
        Specified by:
        refreshData in class MoodListAdapter

      • setUserEvent

        public void setUserEvent(User user)
        Updates the MoodEvent shown in the list for this User. If the User already has an entry in the list it is replaced with their most recent MoodEvent. If their most recent MoodEvent is null, then it checks the list to remove any event associated with the User. MoodEvents are filtered by the set filter
        Parameters:
        user - The User whose event you are updating
